Text: Tua Sin M'im.
These are verses of the Glorious Book.
O Muhammad, you will perhaps fret yourself to death with grief\n\t\t\tbecause they do not believe.
If We wanted, We could send down upon them a sign from the heaven\n\t\t\tbefore which they would bend their necks in submission, but that\n\t\t\tis not what We want.
They have been turning their backs on each fresh warning that\n\t\t\tcomes to them from the Compassionate (Allah).
But now that they have neglected the warning, they will soon come\n\t\t\tto know the reality of what they have been mocking at.
Have they not looked at the earth to see how We have caused all\n\t\t\tkinds of noble pairs to grow in it?
Surely in this there is a sign; yet most of them do not believe.
In fact your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
Remind them of the story when your Rabb called Musa (Moses) and\n\t\t\tsaid: "Go to the wicked people
the people of Fir'on (Pharaoh). Have they no fear?"
Musa submitted, saying: "My Rabb! I fear that they will reject\n\t\t\tme.
My breast feels cramped and my tongue is not eloquent; send\n\t\t\tHaroon (Aaron).
They have a charge of manslaughter against me and I fear they may\n\t\t\tput me to death."
Allah said: "Indeed not! Proceed, both of you, with Our signs;\n\t\t\tsurely We are with you, listening.
Go to Fir'on and tell him: "We are the Rasools from the Rabb of\n\t\t\tthe Worlds.
You should send with us the Children of Israel."
When they went to Fir'on and conveyed the Message of Allah, he\n\t\t\tsaid: "Did we not cherish you when you were a child? Did you not\n\t\t\tstay several years of your life among us?
Then you did what you did; you are so ungrateful!"
Musa replied: "I did that when I was a misguided youth.
I fled from you all because I feared you; but now my Rabb has\n\t\t\tgranted me wisdom and appointed me as one of His Rasools.
Is it a favor with which you taunt me, that you have enslaved the\n\t\t\tChildren of Israel?"
Fir'on said: "Who is this Rabb of the Worlds?"
Musa replied: "He is the Rabb of the heavens and the earth and\n\t\t\tall that lies between them, if you really care to believe".
Fir'on said to those around him, "Do you hear that?"
Musa continued: "He is your Rabb and the Rabb of your\n\t\t\tforefathers."
Fir'on interjected: "This Rasool of yours, who has been sent to\n\t\t\tyou, is crazy".
Musa continued:" He is the Rabb of the east and west, and all\n\t\t\tthat lies between them. If you would only care and try to\n\t\t\tunderstand."
At this, Fir'on, who did not want to listen any more said: "If\n\t\t\tyou serve any other god besides me, I shall have you thrown into\n\t\t\tprison."
At this, Musa said: "What if I show you a convincing sign?"
Fir'on said: "Go ahead, show it if you are of the truthful."
Hearing this, Musa threw down his staff, and thereupon it changed\n\t\t\tinto veritable serpent.
Then he drew forth his hand and it became shining bright for the\n\t\t\tspectators.
After witnessing both the miracles, Fir'on (Pharaoh) said to the\n\t\t\tchiefs around him: "This fellow is certainly a skilled magician,
who seeks to drive you out from your land by the force of his\n\t\t\tmagic. Now what is your advice?"
They submitted: "Put him and his brother off for a while, and\n\t\t\tdispatch heralds to the various cities
to bring you every skilled magician."
So the magicians were brought together at the appointment time on\n\t\t\ta fixed day.
The people were motivated through saying: "Would you come to the\n\t\t\tgathering?
So that we may follow the magicians if they are dominant".
When the magicians arrived, they asked Fir'on: "Shall we get a\n\t\t\treward if we are dominant?"
Fir'on replied: "Yes of course! You will even be made my\n\t\t\tcourtiers."
Musa said to them: "Cast down what you are going to cast."
Thereupon they cast down their ropes and staffs, saying: "By the\n\t\t\tglory of Fir'on, we shall be the winners."
Then Musa threw down his staff, and lo! It swallowed their false\n\t\t\tdevices.
At this, all the magicians prostrated themselves,
saying: "We believe in the Rabb of the Worlds,
the Rabb of Musa (Moses) and Haroon (Aaron)."

Fir'on shouted: "How dare you believe in him before I give you
			permission? He must be your master who taught you the witchcraft.
			But soon you shall find out. I will cut off your hands and your
			feet on opposite sides and crucify you all."
They replied: "We don't care! We are going to return to our Rabb\n\t\t\tanyway.
We only desire that our Rabb may forgive us our sins, as we are\n\t\t\tthe first to believe."
We revealed to Musa (Moses), saying: "Set off with my servants by\n\t\t\tnight and beware that you will be pursued."
Fir'on (Pharaoh) sent heralds to all the cities,
and to mobilize his people he said: "These Israelites are but a\n\t\t\thandful of people,
who have provoked us much;
while we have a large army, well prepared."
Thus did We make them leave their gardens and their water\n\t\t\tsprings,
their treasures and sumptuous dwellings.
This is how they were made to lose, while on the other hand We\n\t\t\tmade the Children of Israel inheritors of such things.
At sunrise the Egyptians pursued them.
When the two hosts came face to face, the companions of Musa\n\t\t\tcried out: "We are surely overtaken."
Musa said: "Not at all! My Rabb is with me; He will show me a way\n\t\t\tout."
Then We revealed Our will to Musa: "Strike the sea with your\n\t\t\tstaff," and the sea was cleft asunder, each part stood like a\n\t\t\tmighty mountain.
We made the other party (Fir'on and his army) follow them.
We delivered Musa and all who were with him;
and drowned the others.
Surely there is a lesson in this: yet most of these people do not\n\t\t\tlearn this lesson to become believers.
The fact is that your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
Narrate to them the story of Ibrahim,
when he asked his father and his people: "What is that which you\n\t\t\tworship?"
They replied: "We worship idols, and sit beside them with all\n\t\t\tdevotion."
Ibrahim asked: "Do they hear you when you call on them?
Can they help you or harm you?"
They replied: "No! But we found our forefathers doing so."
Ibrahim said: "Have you ever seen with open eyes these which you\n\t\t\thave been worshipping
- you and your forefathers?
They are all enemies to me; except the Rabb of the Worlds,
Who created me, then He gave me guidance.
He is the One Who gives me food and drink,
Who gives me health when I get sick,
Who will cause me to die and then bring me back to life,
Who, I hope, will forgive me my mistakes on the Day of Judgment."
After this, Ibrahim prayed: "O my Rabb! Bestow wisdom upon me and\n\t\t\tadmit me among the righteous,
grant me a reputation of truthfulness on the tongue of later\n\t\t\tgenerations,
count me among the inheritors of the paradise of Bliss;
forgive my father, for he is from among those who have gone\n\t\t\tastray,
do not hold me up in shame on the Day when everybody will be\n\t\t\traised back to life
- the Day when neither wealth nor sons will avail anyone,
and when none shall be saved except him who will come before\n\t\t\tAllah with a pure heart,
when paradise shall be brought in the sight of the righteous;
while hell shall be spread open to the straying
and they will be asked: "Now, where are those whom you worshipped
besides Allah? Can they help you or even help themselves?"
Then they will be toppled into it, both they and those who misled\n\t\t\tthem,
together with all the armies of Iblees.
Wherein they will argue with one another
saying: " By Allah, we were indeed in manifest error,
when we made you equals with the Rabb of the Worlds.
It was the criminals who led us astray.
Now we have no intercessors,
and no loving friends.
If we could but once return to our worldly life, we would be of\n\t\t\tthe true believers."
Surely in this narration there is a great lesson, but most of\n\t\t\tthese people do not learn a lesson to become believers.
The fact is that your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
The people of Nuh, also, rejected the Rasools.
Remember when their brother Nuh asked them: "Have you no fear of\n\t\t\tAllah?
Rest assured that I am a trustworthy Rasool of Allah towards you,
so fear Allah and obey me.
I do not ask you any reward for my services, for my reward will\n\t\t\tbe given by the Rabb of the Worlds,
so fear Allah and obey me."
They replied: "Should we believe in you, whereas your followers\n\t\t\tare but the lowest of the low?"
He said: "I have no knowledge as to what they have been doing;
their account is the concern of my Rabb, if you could use your\n\t\t\tcommon sense!
I am not going to drive away any believer .
I am nothing but a plain Warner."
They said: "O Nuh! If you do not stop, you shall be stoned to\n\t\t\tdeath."
Nuh prayed: "O Rabb! My people have disobeyed me.
Decide the case between me and them openly. Deliver me and the\n\t\t\tbelievers who are with me."
So We granted his prayer, delivered him and those with him in the\n\t\t\tladen ark,
and drowned the rest in the flood.
Surely in this story there is a great lesson, but most of these\n\t\t\tpeople do not learn a lesson and become believers.
The fact is that your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
The people of 'Ad, too, disbelieved their Rasools.
Remember when their brother Hud asked them: "Have you no fear of\n\t\t\tAllah?
Rest assured that I am a trustworthy Rasool of Allah towards you.
So fear Allah and obey me.
I do not ask you any reward for my services, for my reward will\n\t\t\tbe given by the Rabb of the Worlds.
Are you erecting a monument on every high place for fun?
Are you building strong fortresses as if you are going to live\n\t\t\there forever?
Whenever you lay your hands on anyone, you act like cruel\n\t\t\ttyrants.
Have fear of Allah and obey me.
Fear the One Who has given you all the things that you know.
He has given you flocks and children,
gardens and fountains.
Truly I fear for you the torment of a dreadful Day."
They replied: "It is the same to us whether you preach us or you\n\t\t\tare not one of the preachers.
Such preaching is nothing but an ancient myth.
We are not going to be punished."
So they disbelieved him and We utterly destroyed them. Surely in\n\t\t\tthis story there is a great lesson, but most of these people do\n\t\t\tnot learn a lesson and become believers.
The fact is that your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
The people of Thamud also disbelieved their Rasools.
Remember when their brother Saleh asked them: "Have you no fear\n\t\t\tof Allah?
Rest assured that I am a trustworthy Rasool of Allah towards you.
So fear Allah and obey me.
I do not ask you any reward for my services, for my reward will\n\t\t\tbe given by the Rabb of the Worlds.
Will you be left in peace to enjoy all that you have here\n\t\t\tforever?
Gardens and fountains,
cornfields and palm-trees laden with juicy fruit,
carving your dwellings in the mountains and leading a happy life?
Have fear of Allah and obey me.
Do not follow the bidding of extravagant,
who create corruption in the land and reform nothing."
They replied: "You are but one of the bewitched!
You are no more than a human being like us. Bring forth a sign if\n\t\t\tyou are one of the truthful."
Saleh said: "Well, here is the she-camel (the sign that you asked\n\t\t\tfor). She shall have her share of water as you all have yours,\n\t\t\teach drinking on an alternate appointed day.
Do not touch her with evil, lest the punishment of a dreadful Day\n\t\t\tmay overtake you."
Yet they hamstrung her, then became full of regrets;
so the punishment overtook them. Surely in this story there is a\n\t\t\tgreat lesson, but most of these people do not learn a lesson and\n\t\t\tbecome believers.
The fact is that your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
The people of Lut (Lot), also, disbelieved their Rasools.
Remember when their brother Lut asked them: "Have you no fear of\n\t\t\tAllah?
Rest assured that I am a trustworthy Rasool of Allah towards you.
So fear Allah and obey me.
I do not ask you any reward for my services, for my reward will\n\t\t\tbe given by the Rabb of the Worlds.
Will you fornicate with males from among the creatures of the\n\t\t\tworlds
and leave those whom your Rabb has created for you to be your\n\t\t\tmates? Nay! You are a people who have transgressed all limits."
They replied: "If you do not stop, O Lut, you shall become one of\n\t\t\tthe expelled."
Lut said: "I am certainly one of those who abhor your actions.
O Rabb! Deliver me and my family from their wicked deeds."
So We delivered him and all his family
except an old woman who was left among those who remained behind.
Then We utterly destroyed the rest.
We rained down on them the rain of brimstones: and evil was the\n\t\t\train which fell on those who were forewarned.
Surely in this story there is a great lesson, but most of these\n\t\t\tpeople do not learn a lesson and become believers.
The fact is that your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
The people of Aiykah, also, disbelieved their Rasools.
Remember Shu'aib asked them: "Have you no fear of Allah?
Rest assured that I am a trustworthy Rasool of Allah towards you.
So fear Allah and obey me.
I do not ask you any reward for my services, for my reward will\n\t\t\tbe given by the Rabb of the Worlds.
Give full measure and be not of those who cause losses to others\n\t\t\tby fraud.
Weigh with even scales
and do not cheat your fellow men of what is rightly theirs: nor\n\t\t\tspread evil in the land.
Fear Him Who has created you and the generations before you".
They replied: "You are surely one of those who are bewitched.
You are no more than a human being like us and we think that you\n\t\t\tare lying.
Let a fragment fall out of the sky on us if you are telling the\n\t\t\tTruth".
Shu'aib said: "My Rabb has full knowledge of all your actions".
So they disbelieved him, and the torment of the day of darkness\n\t\t\t(dark clouds carrying Allah's scourge) seized them, and indeed it\n\t\t\twas the torment of an extremely dreadful day.
Surely in this story there is a great lesson, but most of these\n\t\t\tpeople do not learn a lesson and become believers.
The fact is that your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
Surely this Qur'an is a revelation from the Rabb of the Worlds.
The trustworthy Spirit (Angel Gabriel) brought it down
upon your heart so that you may become one of those who are\n\t\t\tappointed by Allah to warn the people
in a plain Arabic language.
This fact was foretold in the scriptures of the former people.
Is it not sufficient proof for the people that the learned men of\n\t\t\tthe children of Israel knew about it?
Even so that if We had revealed it to a non-Arab,
and he had recited it to them in fluent Arabic, they would still\n\t\t\tnot have believed in it.
We have thus caused unbelief in the hearts of the guilty.
They are not going to believe in it until they see the painful\n\t\t\tscourge
which, in their heedlessness, will come to them suddenly.
Then they will ask: "Can we be given some respite?"
Do they wish to hurry on Our scourge?
Just think! If We let them enjoy this life for many years,
and then the scourge with which they are threatened falls upon\n\t\t\tthem,
of what avail will their past enjoyments be to them?
Never have We destroyed a population to whom We did not send\n\t\t\tWarners;
they were forewarned, and We have never been unjust.
This Qur'an is not brought down by the shaitans:
it is neither in their interest nor in their power to produce\n\t\t\tsuch a masterpiece.
They are kept too far off to even hear it.
So do not call on other gods besides Allah, lest you become one\n\t\t\tof those who incur His punishment.
Admonish your close relatives
and lower your wing of kindness to those of the believers who\n\t\t\tfollow you,
but if they disobey, tell them: "I am not accountable for what\n\t\t\tyou do."
Put your trust in the All-Mighty, the Merciful,
Who observes you when you get up
and when you walk among those who prostrate themselves in\n\t\t\tworship.
He is the One Who hears all and knows all.
Shall I tell you, O people, on whom the shaitans descend?
They descend on every slandering sinner.
Those who listen to hearsay - and most of them are liars
- and those poets who are followed by those who go astray.
Do you not see, how aimlessly they wander in every valley,
preaching what they do not practice themselves?

However, an exception is made for those (poets) who believe, do
			good deeds, engage much in the remembrance of Allah and defend
			themselves when wronged, showing no vindictiveness. The unjust
			oppressors will soon find out what vicissitudes their affairs
			will take.
